title: Volleyball
quote: The only way to prove that youâ€™re a good sport is to lose. â€“ Ernie Banks
description: Volleyball is a team sport played with a ball that is hit over a net between two teams of six players each. The objective is to score points by grounding the ball on the opponent's side of the court. The game requires teamwork, quick reflexes, and strategic play. Matches are typically played in a best-of-five sets format.

League Format: 1. Urja '24 volleyball will be played in a round-robin format.
2. Teams will play against each other once in the preliminary rounds.
3. The top teams will advance to the knockout stage.
Match Format: 1. Each match consists of 5 sets.
2. The first team to reach 25 points wins a set, with a 2-point advantage required.
3. If the match reaches a 2-2 tie, the final set will be played to 15 points.
Discipline And Regulations: 1. Teams must adhere to the dress code and wear appropriate volleyball attire.
2. Any form of misconduct or unsportsmanlike behavior will result in penalties or disqualification.
3. Teams must be ready to play at the scheduled times and follow the official's decisions.

League Format: 1. Urja '24 table tennis will be played in a round-robin format.
2. Each player will compete against every other player once.
3. The top players based on the number of wins will advance to the knockout stage.
Point System: 2. Matches are played best of 5 sets.
3. Each set is played to 11 points, with a 2-point lead required to win.
Match Format: 1. Each match is played as the best of 5 sets.
2. The first player to reach 11 points wins a set.
3. In the event of a 10-10 tie, play continues until one player achieves a 2-point lead.
Discipline And Regulations: 1. Players must adhere to the dress code specified by the tournament organizers.
2. Disrespect towards opponents or officials will result in penalties or disqualification.
3. Players should be punctual and ready to play at their scheduled times.

title: Hockey

description: Hockey is a team sport played on ice or a field, where two teams of six (ice) or eleven (field) players compete to score goals by hitting a puck or ball into the opposing team's goal. The game requires skill, agility, and teamwork, and it's known for its fast pace and physicality.

League Format: 1. Urja '24 hockey tournament will follow a round-robin format.
2. Teams will play against each other once, with the top teams advancing to the knockout stage.
3. Matches will consist of two halves of 35 minutes each.
Match Format: 1. Each match will have two halves of 35 minutes.
2. In case of a tie, the match will be decided by a penalty shootout.
3. The game will be played according to standard hockey rules, including fouls and penalties.
Discipline And Regulations: 1. Players must respect the referees and adhere to the rules of the game.
2. Unsportsmanlike behavior or violent conduct will result in penalties or ejection from the game.
3. Teams must be present and ready to start the match at the scheduled time.

title: Badminton
quote: The more I practice, the luckier I get. â€“ Gary Player
description: Badminton is a racquet sport played with a shuttlecock that is hit back and forth over a net. It can be played in singles or doubles format. The objective is to score points by landing the shuttlecock in the opponent's court. The game is known for its fast pace and requires agility, quick reflexes, and precise shot-making.

League Format: 1. Urja '24 badminton will be held in a round-robin format.
2. Each player or team will compete against every other participant or team once.
3. The top players or teams based on wins will advance to the knockout stage.
Point System: 3. The player or team that wins 2 sets first wins the match.
Match Format: 1. Each match consists of 3 sets.
2. Each set is played to 21 points, with a 2-point advantage required to win.
3. In the event of a 20-20 tie, play continues until one player or team has a 2-point lead.
Discipline And Regulations: 1. Players must follow the dress code specified by the tournament organizers.
2. Unsportsmanlike conduct or verbal abuse will result in penalties or disqualification.
3. Players must be punctual and ready for their matches at the scheduled times.

title: Cricket
quote: You donâ€™t win or lose the games because of the 11 you select. You win or lose with what those 11 do on the field. â€“ Rahul Dravid
description: Cricket is a super popular sport played with a bat and ball. This game is played by two teams of 11 players each. It's all about scoring runs and getting the other team out. It is played on a pitch in a well-maintained field. There are different formats like Test matches and One Day Internationals. It's a game full of excitement, strategy, and amazing moments.

League Format: 1. Urja '24 cricket will be a tennis ball tournament.
2. The Tournament will consist of group stages followed by semis and finals.
3. The group stage consists of 2 groups, from which 2 teams from each group will qualify for the semis.
Point System: 1. 2 Points will be awarded to the winning team.
2. 0 Points will be awarded to the losing team.
3. 1 Point will be awarded to both teams if the match could not take place due to unavoidable circumstances.
4. In case of a tie in points, the team with a higher Net Run Rate will be placed higher.
Match Format: 1. Every match will have a maximum of 14 Overs.
2. There will be field restrictions (powerplay) for the first 5 overs of each innings where only 2 fielders will be allowed outside the inner circle.
3. Only 4 bowlers are allowed to bowl a maximum of 3 overs each.
4. If a wicket falls through caught, the new batsman will take the strike irrespective of whether the non-striker has crossed the halfway mark.
5. Mankading will be considered legal and will be counted as a runout.
6. Any kind of no-ball will result in a free hit (batsman can only be dismissed via runout) to the batting team on the next ball.
7. LBW dismissal will not be considered.
8. No runs will be counted through leg byes.
9. Runs will be counted through wides, no balls, byes, and will be considered as extras.
10. If the match ends in a tie, the result will be decided by a SUPER OVER (6 balls each team), with the team batting second batting first in the super over.
11. If the Super Over ends in a tie, the result will be decided by another Super Over, and it will continue until there is an outcome.
12. The final decisions on the field will be taken by the umpires, and no objections will be entertained.
Discipline And Regulations: 1. Players and team officials must at all times accept the umpireâ€™s decision. Players must not show dissent at the umpireâ€™s decision or react in a provocative or disapproving manner towards another player or a spectator.
2. The captains are responsible at all times for ensuring that their team has reached the ground before the scheduled time.
3. Any player violating any disciplinary regulations will face serious consequences.

title: Lawn Tennis
quote: The mark of great sportsmen is not how good they are at their best, but how good they are at their worst. â€“ Martina Navratilova
description: Tennis is a popular racket sport that can be played individually against a single opponent or between two teams of two players each. The game is played on a rectangular court with a net in the middle. Players use a stringed racket to strike a ball over the net into the opponent's court. Itâ€™s a game that requires agility, speed, and strategy.

League Format: 1. Urja '24 tennis tournament will be a knockout format.
2. Matches will be best of 3 sets.
3. The tournament will have separate categories for singles and doubles.
Point System: 1. 2 Points will be awarded to the winner of each match.
2. 0 Points will be awarded to the loser of the match.
3. In case of a tie in points, the winner of the head-to-head match between tied players will be ranked higher.
Match Format: 1. Each set will be played up to 6 games, with a tiebreaker at 6-6.
2. In the case of a 3rd set, it will be played as a super tiebreaker if both players have won one set each.
3. Players must win by at least 2 games to win a set.
4. Standard tennis rules apply including foot faults, let serves, and correct scoring.
Discipline And Regulations: 1. Players must adhere to the dress code specified by the tournament organizers.
2. Players are expected to maintain sportsmanship and respect opponents and officials.
3. Any form of unsportsmanlike conduct, including abuse of equipment, will result in penalties or disqualification.

title: Basketball
quote: Talent wins games, but teamwork and intelligence win championships. â€“ Michael Jordan
description: Basketball is an exciting team sport where two teams of five players each try to score by throwing a ball through the opposing team's hoop. The game is played on a rectangular court with a hoop at each end. It requires speed, strategy, and teamwork, and it's a game full of fast-paced action and skill.

League Format: 1. Urja '24 basketball tournament will follow a knockout format.
2. The tournament will consist of quarterfinals, semifinals, and a final.
3. Each match will be played between two teams, with the winner advancing to the next round.
Point System: 1. 2 Points will be awarded to the winning team.
2. 0 Points will be awarded to the losing team.
3. In case of a tie in points after the group stage, the team with the highest point differential will advance.
Match Format: 1. Each match will consist of 4 quarters of 10 minutes each.
2. In case of a tie at the end of regulation time, an additional 5-minute overtime period will be played.
3. The game will be played according to standard basketball rules, including fouls, free throws, and 3-point shots.
4. Substitutions can be made at any stoppage of play.
discipline & Regulations: 1. Players must respect the referees and accept their decisions without protest.
2. Unsportsmanlike conduct, such as arguing with referees or opponents, will result in a technical foul.
3. Teams must be present on the court at least 10 minutes before the scheduled start time.

title: Chess
quote: Chess is the gymnasium of the mind. â€“ Blaise Pascal
description: Chess is a two-player strategy board game played on an 8x8 grid. Each player starts with 16 pieces including a king, queen, rooks, knights, bishops, and pawns. The objective is to checkmate the opponent's king. It requires deep strategic thinking and planning.

League Format: 1. Urja '24 chess tournament will be played in a round-robin format.
2. Each player will compete against every other player once.
3. The top players based on the number of wins will advance to the knockout stage.
Match Format: 1. Each match will consist of one game played with standard chess rules.
2. Time control will be 15 minutes per player with a 10-second increment per move.
3. If a game is drawn, it will be counted as 0.5 points for each player.
Discipline And Regulations: 1. Players must respect their opponents and the tournament officials.
2. Any form of cheating or unsportsmanlike behavior will result in immediate disqualification.
3. Players are required to keep their devices off during the game.

title: Football

description: Football, also known as soccer in some countries, is the world's most popular sport. It is played between two teams of 11 players with a spherical ball. The aim is to score by getting the ball into the opposing goal. Football is played on a rectangular field with a goal at each end. It is a game that requires skill, strategy, and teamwork.

League Format: 1. Urja '24 football will follow a league format with teams divided into groups.
2. The top teams from each group will advance to the knockout stage.
3. Matches will be played in two halves of 30 minutes each.
Match Format: 1. Each match will consist of two 30-minute halves with a 10-minute halftime break.
2. In the event of a tie during knockout rounds, the match will be decided by a penalty shootout.
3. Standard football rules will apply, including offsides, fouls, and yellow/red cards.
4. Substitutions: Each team can make up to 3 substitutions during the match.
Discipline And Regulations: 1. All players must respect the referee's decisions and conduct themselves with sportsmanship.
2. Violent conduct or abusive language will result in a red card and immediate ejection from the match.
3. Teams must be ready to start the match at the scheduled time.

Point System: 1. Points will be awarded based on the clarity and execution of poses.
2. A panel of judges will score each performance out of 10.
3. The participant with the highest total score will be declared the winner.
Match Format: 1. Each participant will perform a sequence of poses in a pre-defined order.
2. The performance will be evaluated based on grace, alignment, and adherence to the poses.
3. Participants are expected to demonstrate smooth transitions between poses.
